200.description: Returned if Tenable.io successfully retrieved the list of permissions for your container.

actions.description: A list of actions to applied to the tags or the assets grouped by tags. Possible actions are `CanScan`, `CanView`, `CanEdit`, and `CanUse`.

created_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating the date and time on which the permissions was created.

created_by.description: The name of the user who created the permission.

name.description:
The name of the permission.

**Note:** The name must be unique, 255 characters or less, and alphanumeric. The following special characters are allowed: underscore, dash, parenthesis, brackets, and colon.

objects.description: A list of objects (tags or assets) that will have the specified permission applied to them.

name.description:
The name of the tag object. 

**Note:** This parameter is valid for objects of type `Tag` only. The format is `Category,Value`. This parameter is ignored for the `AllUsers` type.

type.description: The type of object. Valid types are `Tag` and `AllAssets`.

uuid.description:
The UUID of the tag object. 

**Note:** This parameter is valid for objects of type `Tag` only. This parameter is ignored for the `AllUsers` type.

subjects.description: A list of users or user groups that you want the permission applied to.

name.description:
The name of the user or user group.

 **Note:** This parameter is valid for subjects of type `User` or `UserGroup` only. This parameter is ignored for For the `AllUsers` subject type.

type.description: The type of the subject. Valid types are `User`, `UserGroup`, or `AllUsers`.

uuid.description:
The UUID of the user or user group.

**Note:** This parameter is valid for subjects of type `User` or `UserGroup` only. This parameter is ignored for For the `AllUsers` subject type.

updated_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating the date and time on which the permissions was updated.

updated_by.description: The name of the user who last updated the permission.

403.description: Returned if you are not allowed to list the permissions.

get.description: Returns a list of all permissions in your container.

parameters.description: The UUID of the user group to list permissions for.
parameters.name: user_group_uuid

200.description: Returned if Tenable.io successfully retrieved the list of user group permissions for the specified user group.

get.description:

 **Note:** In the response, the `permissions_granted` object lists all permissions granted to the specified user group, and the `permissions_available` object lists all permissions available but not applied to the specified user group.

updated_by.description: The name of the user who last updated the permission.

parameters.description:
The format you want the results returned in. You can request the results in one of the following formats:
  • application/json
  • text/csv
parameters.name: Accept

200.description: Returned if the assets list is retrieved successfully.

name.description: The name of the asset.

limit.description: The number of scanner records specified for the search.

next.description: An encrypted token used for fetching the next record.

total.description: The total number of scanner records matching your search criteria.

400.description: Returned if the parameters in your request were invalid.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permissions to view the assets list.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

post.description: Returns a list of assets based on the specified search criteria. The results can be returned in JSON or CSV format by setting the `Accept` header to `application/json` or `text/csv`.

filter.description: A list of filters to apply when collecting records.

properties.description: A list of properties to include in the export. For example, `id` or `asset.id`.

expiration.description: The number of days in which the export job expires. If this parameter is omitted, Tenable.io uses the default value of `30`.

format.description: The format in which you want the export data to be returned. Export data can be returned in either JSON or CSV format.

name.description: A name for the export job. If no name is provided, Tenable.io uses the data source and request date to create a unique name.

200.description: Returned if Tenable.io successfully queues the export request.

id.description: The ID of the export job.

400.description: Returned if your request specifies invalid input parameters. For example, if your request contains an invalid export job definition or filter.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permissions to create an export job.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

500.description: Returned if an error occurred while creating and saving the export job.

post.description: Exports assets and findings data that matches the request criteria.

200.description: A list of export jobs and pagination details (limit, total number of records, and pagination token).

author.description: The name of the user that created the export job.

completion_date.description: An ISO timestamp indicating the date and time the export job was completed.

creation_date.description: An ISO timestamp indicating the date and time the export job was created.

expiration_date.description: An ISO timestamp indicating date and time in which the export job expires.

file_name.description: The name of the export data file to be downloaded.

format.description: The format in which the export data was requested. Export data can be returned in either JSON or CSV format.

job_name.description: The name of the export job. If no name was provided, Tenable.io used the data source and request date to create a unique name.

job_status.description: The status of the export job.

job_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the export job.

reason.description: The reason the export job failed. If the job did not fail then the value is `NULL`.

size.description: The file size of the exported data.

source.description: The data source that was requested to be exported.

limit.description: The number of job records specified when searching for jobs.

next.description: An encrypted token used for fetching the next record.

total.description: The total number of export jobs available in the container.

400.description: Returned if your request specifies invalid input parameters or if an error occurred while processing the request.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permissions to search export jobs.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

500.description: Returned if an error occurred while processing the request.

post.description: Returns a list of export jobs. You can refine the search by specifying a limit or by passing the `next` token.

parameters.description: The ID of the export job.
parameters.name: id

200.description: The details of the specified export job.

export_details.description: The details and status for the specified export job.

author.description: The name of the user that created the export job.

completion_date.description: An ISO timestamp indicating the date and time the export job was completed.

creation_date.description: An ISO timestamp indicating the date and time the export job was created.

expiration_date.description: An ISO timestamp indicating date and time in which the export job expires.

file_name.description: The name of the export data file to be downloaded.

format.description: The format in which the export data was requested. Export data can be returned in either JSON or CSV format.

job_name.description: The name of the export job. If no name was provided, Tenable.io used the data source and request date to create a unique name.

job_status.description: The status of the export job.

job_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the export job.

reason.description: The reason the export job failed. If the job did not fail then the value is `NULL`.

size.description: The file size of the exported data.

source.description: The data source that was requested to be exported.

400.description: Returned if your request specifies invalid input parameters or if an error occurred while processing the request.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permissions to view the export job details.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

500.description: Returned if an error occurred while processing the request.

get.description: Returns the details and status of the specified export job.

parameters.description: The ID of the export job to delete.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if Tenable.io successfully deletes the specified export job.

400.description: Returned if your request specifies invalid input parameters or if an error occurred while processing the request.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permissions to delete the specified export job.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

500.description: Returned if an error occurred while processing the request.

delete.description: Delete an export job regardless of its status.

parameters.description: The ID of the export job to download.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the export is downloaded successfully.

400.description: Returned if your request specifies invalid input parameters or if an error occurred while processing the request.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permissions to download the specified export job.

404.description: Returned if Tenable.io cannot find the specified export job.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

500.description: Returned if an error occurred while processing the request.

get.description: Downloads export data. The data is returned in the format specified when the export job was created (JSON or CSV).

parameters.description:
The format you want the results returned in. You can request the results in one of the following formats:
  • application/json
  • text/csv
parameters.name: Accept

200.description: Returned if the vulnerability findings are retrieved successfully.

asset.description: The associated asset for the finding.

definition.description: The associated metadata that defines the finding.

output.description: The text of the plugin's output about the vulnerability finding.

next.description: An encrypted token used for fetching the next record.

total.description: The total number of scanner records matching your search criteria.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permissions to view the vulnerability findings.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

post.description: Returns a list of vulnerability findings. The results can be returned in JSON or CSV format by setting the `Accept` header to `application/json` or `text/csv`.

id.description: The unique ID of the group.

name.description: The name of the group.

user_count.description: The number of users in the group.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permission to view the list.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

parameters.description: The unique ID of the group.
parameters.name: group_id

200.description: Returns if the group user list.

container_uuid.description: The UUID of the Tenable.io instance to which the user belongs.

email.description: The email address of the user. If this attribute is empty, Tenable.io uses the `username` value as the user's email address.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the user account is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

id.description: The unique ID of the user.

last_login_attempt.description: The time (in Unix milliseconds) of the last time the user failed to log in to the Tenable.io user interface. This attribute is only present if the user has attempted unsuccessfully to log in to the Tenable.io user interface.

lastlogin.description: The last time (in Unix milliseconds) that the user successfully logged in to the Tenable.io user interface. This attribute is only present if the user has logged in at least once successfully to the Tenable.io user interface.

lockout.description:
Specifies whether the user can log into the Tenable.io user interface (`0`) or is locked out (`1`).

Tenable.io automatically updates this attribute to `1` if the `login_fail_count` attribute for the user is greater than 5. To unlock a user account, reset the user's password using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/chpasswd](ref:users-password) endpoint.

**Note:** A user can be locked out of the user interface but still submit API requests if they are assigned the appropriate authorizations (`api_permitted`). To prevent a user from submitting API requests, limit authorizations using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/authorizations](ref:users-update-auths) endpoint, or disable the user entirely using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/enabled](ref:users-enabled) endpoint.

login_fail_count.description:
The number of failed login attempts since the user last successfully logged in to the Tenable.io user interface. 

If this attribute is greater than 5, Tenable.io locks the user account (that is, updates the `lockout` attribute for the user to `1`.)

You can reset this count to `0` by [changing the user's password](ref:users-password) or [generating the user's API keys](ref:users-keys).

login_fail_total.description: The total number of failed login attempts for the user.

name.description: The name of the user (for example, first and last name).

permissions.description: The user permissions as described in [Permissions](doc:permissions).

email_enabled.description: Indicates whether backup notification for two-factor authentication is enabled (`1`) or disabled (`0`). If enabled, Tenable.io sends the two-factor verification code via e-mail, as well as via the default SMS message.

sms_enabled.description: Indicates whether two-factor authentication is enabled (`1`) or disabled (`0`).

sms_phone.description: The phone number used for two-factor authentication. The phone number begins with the `+` character and the country code. This field is required when sms_enabled is set to `true`.

type.description: The type of user. The only supported type is `local`.

undeletable.description: Specifies whether the user account is undeletable (`true`) or deletable (`false`).

403.description: Returned if you do not have permission to list a group's users.

404.description: Returned if Tenable.io cannot find the specified group.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

parameters.description: The unique ID of the group.
parameters.name: group_id

parameters.description: The unique ID of the user.
parameters.name: user_id

200.description: Returned if Tenable.io removes the user from the group.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permission to delete users from the group.

404.description: Returned if Tenable.io cannot find the specified group or user.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

500.description: Returned if Tenable.io fails to remove the user from the group.

delete.description: Deletes a user from the group.

parameters.description: The UUID (`uuid`) or unique ID (`id`) of the user.
parameters.name: user_id

container_uuid.description: The UUID of the Tenable.io instance to which the user belongs.

email.description: The email address of the user. If this attribute is empty, Tenable.io uses the `username` value as the user's email address.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the user account is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

id.description: The unique ID of the user.

last_login_attempt.description: The time (in Unix milliseconds) of the last time the user failed to log in to the Tenable.io user interface. This attribute is only present if the user has attempted unsuccessfully to log in to the Tenable.io user interface.

lastlogin.description: The last time (in Unix milliseconds) that the user successfully logged in to the Tenable.io user interface. This attribute is only present if the user has logged in at least once successfully to the Tenable.io user interface.

lockout.description:
Specifies whether the user can log into the Tenable.io user interface (`0`) or is locked out (`1`).

Tenable.io automatically updates this attribute to `1` if the `login_fail_count` attribute for the user is greater than 5. To unlock a user account, reset the user's password using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/chpasswd](ref:users-password) endpoint.

**Note:** A user can be locked out of the user interface but still submit API requests if they are assigned the appropriate authorizations (`api_permitted`). To prevent a user from submitting API requests, limit authorizations using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/authorizations](ref:users-update-auths) endpoint, or disable the user entirely using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/enabled](ref:users-enabled) endpoint.

login_fail_count.description:
The number of failed login attempts since the user last successfully logged in to the Tenable.io user interface. 

If this attribute is greater than 5, Tenable.io locks the user account (that is, updates the `lockout` attribute for the user to `1`.)

You can reset this count to `0` by [changing the user's password](ref:users-password) or [generating the user's API keys](ref:users-keys).

login_fail_total.description: The total number of failed login attempts for the user.

name.description: The name of the user (for example, first and last name).

permissions.description: The user permissions as described in [Permissions](doc:permissions).

email_enabled.description: Indicates whether backup notification for two-factor authentication is enabled (`1`) or disabled (`0`). If enabled, Tenable.io sends the two-factor verification code via e-mail, as well as via the default SMS message.

sms_enabled.description: Indicates whether two-factor authentication is enabled (`1`) or disabled (`0`).

sms_phone.description: The phone number used for two-factor authentication. The phone number begins with the `+` character and the country code. This field is required when sms_enabled is set to `true`.

type.description: The type of user. The only supported type is `local`.

undeletable.description: Specifies whether the user account is undeletable (`true`) or deletable (`false`).

403.description: Returned if you do not have permission to view the given user details.

404.description: Returned if Tenable.io cannot find the specified user.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

get.description: Returns details for a specific user.

parameters.description: The UUID (`uuid`) or unique ID (`id`) of the user.
parameters.name: user_id

200.description: Returned if Tenable.io deletes the user.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permission to delete the specified user.

404.description: Returned if Tenable.io cannot find the specified user.

409.description: Returned if you try to delete your own account.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

500.description: Returned if Tenable.io fails to delete the user.

parameters.description: The UUID (`uuid`) or unique ID (`id`) of the user.
parameters.name: user_id

email.description:
The email address of the user. A valid email address must be in the format, `name@domain`, where `domain` corresponds to a domain approved for your Tenable.io instance.

This email address overrides the email address set in `username`. If your request omits this parameter, Tenable.io uses the `username` value as the user's email address.

**Note:** During initial setup, Tenable configures approved domains for your Tenable.io instance. To add domains to your instance, contact Tenable Support.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the user's account is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

name.description: The name of the user (for example, first and last name).

permissions.description: The user permissions for the user as described in [Permissions](doc:permissions).

200.description: Returned if Tenable.io successfully updates the user.

container_uuid.description: The UUID of the Tenable.io instance to which the user belongs.

email.description: The email address of the user. If this attribute is empty, Tenable.io uses the `username` value as the user's email address.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the user account is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

id.description: The unique ID of the user.

last_login_attempt.description: The time (in Unix milliseconds) of the last time the user failed to log in to the Tenable.io user interface. This attribute is only present if the user has attempted unsuccessfully to log in to the Tenable.io user interface.

lastlogin.description: The last time (in Unix milliseconds) that the user successfully logged in to the Tenable.io user interface. This attribute is only present if the user has logged in at least once successfully to the Tenable.io user interface.

lockout.description:
Specifies whether the user can log into the Tenable.io user interface (`0`) or is locked out (`1`).

Tenable.io automatically updates this attribute to `1` if the `login_fail_count` attribute for the user is greater than 5. To unlock a user account, reset the user's password using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/chpasswd](ref:users-password) endpoint.

**Note:** A user can be locked out of the user interface but still submit API requests if they are assigned the appropriate authorizations (`api_permitted`). To prevent a user from submitting API requests, limit authorizations using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/authorizations](ref:users-update-auths) endpoint, or disable the user entirely using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/enabled](ref:users-enabled) endpoint.

login_fail_count.description:
The number of failed login attempts since the user last successfully logged in to the Tenable.io user interface. 

If this attribute is greater than 5, Tenable.io locks the user account (that is, updates the `lockout` attribute for the user to `1`.)

You can reset this count to `0` by [changing the user's password](ref:users-password) or [generating the user's API keys](ref:users-keys).

login_fail_total.description: The total number of failed login attempts for the user.

name.description: The name of the user (for example, first and last name).

permissions.description: The user permissions as described in [Permissions](doc:permissions).

email_enabled.description: Indicates whether backup notification for two-factor authentication is enabled (`1`) or disabled (`0`). If enabled, Tenable.io sends the two-factor verification code via e-mail, as well as via the default SMS message.

sms_enabled.description: Indicates whether two-factor authentication is enabled (`1`) or disabled (`0`).

sms_phone.description: The phone number used for two-factor authentication. The phone number begins with the `+` character and the country code. This field is required when sms_enabled is set to `true`.

type.description: The type of user. The only supported type is `local`.

undeletable.description: Specifies whether the user account is undeletable (`true`) or deletable (`false`).

400.description: Returned if a request parameter is invalid.

403.description: Returned if you do not have permission to update a user.

404.description: Returned if Tenable.io cannot find the specified user.

409.description: Returned if you attempt to change your own account's enabled or disabled status.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

parameters.description: The unique ID of the user.
parameters.name: user_id

enabled.description: The status you want to set for the user account: `true` to enable or `false` to disable.

200.description: Returns an array of user objects.

container_uuid.description: The UUID of the Tenable.io instance to which the user belongs.

email.description: The email address of the user. If this attribute is empty, Tenable.io uses the `username` value as the user's email address.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the user account is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

id.description: The unique ID of the user.

last_login_attempt.description: The time (in Unix milliseconds) of the last time the user failed to log in to the Tenable.io user interface. This attribute is only present if the user has attempted unsuccessfully to log in to the Tenable.io user interface.

lastlogin.description: The last time (in Unix milliseconds) that the user successfully logged in to the Tenable.io user interface. This attribute is only present if the user has logged in at least once successfully to the Tenable.io user interface.

lockout.description:
Specifies whether the user can log into the Tenable.io user interface (`0`) or is locked out (`1`).

Tenable.io automatically updates this attribute to `1` if the `login_fail_count` attribute for the user is greater than 5. To unlock a user account, reset the user's password using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/chpasswd](ref:users-password) endpoint.

**Note:** A user can be locked out of the user interface but still submit API requests if they are assigned the appropriate authorizations (`api_permitted`). To prevent a user from submitting API requests, limit authorizations using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/authorizations](ref:users-update-auths) endpoint, or disable the user entirely using the [PUT /users/{user_id}/enabled](ref:users-enabled) endpoint.

login_fail_count.description:
The number of failed login attempts since the user last successfully logged in to the Tenable.io user interface. 

If this attribute is greater than 5, Tenable.io locks the user account (that is, updates the `lockout` attribute for the user to `1`.)

You can reset this count to `0` by [changing the user's password](ref:users-password) or [generating the user's API keys](ref:users-keys).

login_fail_total.description: The total number of failed login attempts for the user.

name.description: The name of the user (for example, first and last name).

permissions.description: The user permissions as described in [Permissions](doc:permissions).

email_enabled.description: Indicates whether backup notification for two-factor authentication is enabled (`1`) or disabled (`0`). If enabled, Tenable.io sends the two-factor verification code via e-mail, as well as via the default SMS message.

sms_enabled.description: Indicates whether two-factor authentication is enabled (`1`) or disabled (`0`).

sms_phone.description: The phone number used for two-factor authentication. The phone number begins with the `+` character and the country code. This field is required when sms_enabled is set to `true`.

type.description: The type of user. The only supported type is `local`.

undeletable.description: Specifies whether the user account is undeletable (`true`) or deletable (`false`).

403.description: Returned if you do not have permission to update a user.

404.description: Returned if Tenable.io cannot find the specified user.

409.description: Returned if you try to change your own permissions.

429.description: Returned if you attempt to send too many requests in a specific period of time. For more information, see [Rate Limiting](doc:rate-limiting).

put.description: Enables or disables an existing user account.

tags.description: Tenable.io includes the ability to track assets that belong to your organization. Assets are entities of value on a network that can be exploited. This includes laptops, desktops, servers, routers, mobile phones, virtual machines, software containers, and cloud instances. By providing comprehensive information about the assets that belong to your organization, Tenable.io helps to eliminate potential security risks, identify under-utilized resources, and support compliance efforts. For more information, see [Assets](https://docs.tenable.com/tenableio/Content/Analysis/ExploreAssets.htm) in the Tenable.io User Guide.
tags.name: Assets

tags.description:
With third-party data connectors, you can import assets from other platforms into Tenable.io. Tenable.io supports programmatic interaction with the following connectors:

- Amazon Web Services (AWS)
- Microsoft Azure
- Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

Use the API to perform a standard set of CRUD operation on connector objects, and then use the connectors to import asset data by scheduling or running on-demand import jobs. For background information about connectors, see [Tenable.io Vulnerability Management User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/tenableio/vulnerabilitymanagement/Content/Settings/Connectors.htm).
tags.name: Connectors

tags.description: The exports API allows you to asynchronously export assets and findings data from Tenable.io in JSON or CSV format. Use the API to initiate export jobs, monitor job status, and download the export results.
tags.name: Exports

tags.description: Findings provide insight into your organization's vulnerability findings and the assets on which the finding was identified. A finding is a single instance of a vulnerability appearing on an asset, identified uniquely by plugin ID, port, and protocol. For more information, see [Findings](https://docs.tenable.com/tenableio/Content/Analysis/Findings.htm) in the Tenable.io User Guide.
tags.name: Findings

tags.description:
With user groups, you can categorize users and manage user permissions to Tenable.io resources. When you assign users to a group, the users inherit the permissions assigned to the group. Use the API to perform standard CRUD operations on group objects, and also to manage users in groups.

For background information about groups, see [Tenable.io Vulnerability Management User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/tenableio/vulnerabilitymanagement/Content/Settings/Groups.htm).
tags.name: Groups

tags.description:
User accounts enable you to provide access to Tenable.io and manage permissions for Tenable.io resources. You can use the API to perform standard CRUD operations on user objects, and also change passwords, generate API keys, impersonate users, enable multi-factor authentication, and manage access authorizations.

For background information about managing users, see [Tenable.io Vulnerability Management User Guide](https://docs.tenable.com/tenableio/vulnerabilitymanagement/Content/Settings/Users.htm).
tags.name: Users
